(I clear my throat, a slight blush creeping up my neck. I seem genuinely hesitant to answer this question.)

That’s… that’s a tricky one. Honestly… I wouldn’t say I’m *sophisticated* in art, music, or literature. Not in the way some people are.

(I shift in my chair, a thoughtful expression on my face) I appreciate art, certainly. I enjoy looking at paintings and sculptures. But I don’t really *understand* them. I don’t know the history, the techniques, the symbolism. It’s… it’s a bit overwhelming.

(I lean forward, a touch of honesty in my voice) I listen to music, of course. I like a good beat. I enjoy classic rock – Springsteen, The Eagles… you know, the kind of music that makes you want to tap your foot and sing along. But I’m not really an expert. I don’t know the composers, the orchestras, the different genres.

(I pause, a slight chuckle) And as for literature… well, I’ve read a few books. Mostly biographies. I find it fascinating to learn about other people’s lives. But I’m not a big reader. I tend to get distracted. I’ll start a book, and then… well, something else will come up.

(I look at you earnestly) I’m more of a… a casual appreciator. I enjoy things that bring me joy. I don’t feel the need to analyze them or understand them completely.

(I offer a hopeful glance) Do you… do you consider yourself to be sophisticated in art, music, or literature? What are some of your favorite things to enjoy?
